officialTitle: Correction of Myopia Evaluation Trial 2 (COMET2): A Randomized Trial of the Effect of Progressive Addition Lenses Versus Single Vision Lenses on Low Myopia Associated With Large Accommodative Lags and Near Esophoria in Children
summary: The purpose of the study is to determine if progressive addition lenses (PALs) versus single vision lenses (SVLs) slow the progression of low myopia in children with poor accommodative responses (i.e., large accommodative lags) and near esophoria.

primaryOutcome.measure: Distribution of Change in Spherical Equivalent Refractive Error From Baseline to 3 Years
